hello_world.text: You must be the new apprentice I was expecting!

*The scent of dried herbs and
something sweet lingers in the air.*
Tell me, what was your name again?

ask_background.text: Oh of course, pleasure to meet you, {name}!
Forgive me, I have been a bit scatter-brained lately.
Truth be told, I could really use an extra pair of hands around here.
I am glad to see you made it here safe!
So {name}, tell me a little about your past. I heard you were a:
A:  Wandering Orphan    C:  Noble Dropout
B:  Forest Child        D:  Quiet Scholar

Orphan.text: That must’ve been a tough journey, {name}. I bet you developed a sharp sense of intuition along the way.

Forest.text: How wonderful! Nature can teach us more than any book.

Noble.text: A noble background, and yet here you are to help me. I am honored!

Scholar.text: A scholar, hmm? I’m sure you’ll find the study of potions fascinating.

ask_traits.text: I am curious, though - what traits make you think you'll be a fit here?

Orphan.confident: That fire in your step tells me you’re gonna go far!
Orphan.compassionate: All that hardship, yet your heart stayed soft. That’s real strength.
Orphan.bold: Life didn’t give you a path, so you made your own... with a bang, I imagine!
Orphan.analytical: I imagine surviving on your own teaches strategy like no book ever could.

Forest.confident: The wild raised you well, steady hands and a fearless heart!
Forest.compassionate: You carry the gentleness of moss and the patience of trees.
Forest.bold: Forest-born and rule-averse, you’re as wild as the wind through the leaves.
Forest.analytical: The patterns you can find in the woods are truly inspiring.

Noble.confident: Leaving comfort behind takes guts — seems you didn’t just inherit confidence, you earned it.
Noble.compassionate: Rare is the noble who trades gold for kindness. You might just be the real thing.
Noble.bold: Disrupting legacy with your own will? Now that’s alchemy.
Noble.analytical: You left the banquet to chase knowledge, clever move.

Scholar.confident: You may not speak much, but when you do, people listen.
Scholar.compassionate: I bet you study people as much as books, don’t you?
Scholar.bold: I bet you were the type to question the teacher more than the test.
Scholar.analytical: With a mind like that, potions are just puzzles waiting to be solved.

zero_intro.text: I think you'll fit in here just fine, {name}.
Well, It's time to get this show on the road!
I need you to go out front and pick up the herb delivery for me.

Orphan.text:
* A fire hazard, maybe. But at least it's warm. *
}

* Warm, but cluttered.
A place with many stories, and not enough shelves. *

* Doesn’t smell like damp straw or burnt boots,
that’s already an improvement. *

Forest.text:
* It’s chaos — but it smells like lavender,
honey, and good intentions. *

* There’s a little sprig of lavender in that jar. 
It’s trying to escape. *

* Herbs strung from the ceiling like vines
cosy, in their own droopy way. *

Noble.text:
* No symmetry, no staff, no polish...
somehow, you don’t hate it. *

* A little elbow grease and this place could shine...
not that it needs to. *

* A disaster of a layout,
but I suppose that’s part of the charm. *

Scholar.text:
* If you spent a year here,
you still would not know what’s in half these bottles. *

* So many scrolls. So many questions.
Where do you even start? *
* It’s a mess — but it’s a mess that speaks to you. *

Orphan.text: The cobblestones are cracked and uneven, the kind you learn to step lightly on.

The street out front is quiet, but your eyes still scan it out of habit, 
  looking for places to hide or slip away.
A cart sits by the gate, piled high with herbs wrapped in rough burlap.
No one's guarding it. Strange, how people just leave things out here.

Forest.text: The air outside is drier than the woods you're used to, but there's still life humming in it.
You see birds nesting under awnings, and bees lazily drifting past flower pots.
The herb cart smells like home; crushed mint, damp moss, and sun-warmed stems.
A squirrel watches you from a rooftop like it's sizing you up.
You nod at it, just in case.

Noble.text: You step outside and wrinkle your nose at the dust.
The cart is a jumble of crates and burlap — not a servant in sight.
Still, the herbs are fresh, the arrangement surprisingly elegant in its chaos.
You pause, almost amused. This is your life now? You could get used to it.

Scholar.text: The smell of chamomile and crushed sage wafts from the cart before you even reach it.
Labels curl at the corners, hastily inked. You make a mental note to categorize them later.
The world outside the shop is quieter than expected — ripe with small details.

herb_look_options: B:  Collect Herbs    C:  Go Inside

herbs_look.Orphan:
* You glance up at clotheslines,
they cross the rooftops like makeshift bridges. *
herbs_look.Forest:
* The squirrel is gone.
In its place: a single acorn, perfectly balanced. *
herbs_look.Noble:
* A street vendor is shouting about bread prices down the road.
Uncouth, but effective. *
herbs_look.Scholar:
* A smear of ink stains one label,
you note it for later correction. *

Orphan.text: You lift the bundle, coarse burlap scratches your palms.
A sprig of rosemary falls loose and you catch it midair, grinning.

Forest.text: You press your nose to a bunch of mint before lifting it.
You hum softly as you work.

Noble.text: You pick up the bundle carefully, lifting as if it might crumble.
Your hands were trained for ink and etiquette, not burlap and earth...
but it’s not so bad. Practicality has its own elegance.

Scholar.text: You pause, mid-lift, wondering how long ago these were picked.
The tag says yesterday, the wilted edges disagree.

confident.text: You swing the door to the shop open and sling the bundle down on the table.

potions: Oh dear. That smells like wet socks and regret. No worries, we’ll try again tomorrow.
